From observing the final output \\( Z(\\omega) \\), is it possible to determine definitively whether the intervention (the filter \\( F(\\omega) \\)) was applied, and what the original signal \\( x(t) \\) was?

This convolution masks the clarity required to distinctly identify whether the intervention occurred and what the characteristics of the original input were. Without explicit knowledge of the transformations and the initial signal characteristics, the reconstruction and verification of both the intervention and original signal are ambiguous.
